Topic.Title: Looks like WalMart now being used as source of capital rather than AAPL...

Message.Msg: No. The scam is the imbalance WITHIN the market that exists purely because of option scalping for trading income. AAPL, INTC, CSCO and many large cap companies are held back as to sell calls and MOMO scams propped up to sell puts. Since the advent of weekly options, the multiple trends (lower for undervalued companies on a fundamental basis, higher for those overvalued) have accelerated (expansion for MOMO, contraction for actual investments). Looking at changes in short interest, these things are approaching their end. When the MM don't have a lot of free Bernanke Bux via POMO, it is harder to maintain the scam... But, they are getting help through the further repression of real investments. I care because the investors that ultimately hold real investments are seeing their returns suppressed from this scam so that the institutions can realize additional trading profits... This in turn means the capital markets are sending signals that reward malinvestment and value destruction, simply to enable trading profits. It is destructive for the economy....

Message.Msg: Cash: I've read your link to Lenin revolutionary situation. I believe in markets and capitalism... But, it does seem we are in a little bit of an Animal Farm "some are more equal than others" in terms of how one sector in our economy is being treated wrt all others... BTW, I studied Marx and Minsky in an econ Ph.D. program long ago... Marx was correct about some things at the time, but most of his understanding of value creation is not applicable in the modern world. Minsky is closest to real world understandings that are still appropriate today...

Topic.Title: TurboTax has a big problem if you trade stocks, You better have your FED Taxes checked, If you used there software

Message.Msg: Standard version only allows

Topic.Title: TurboTax has a big problem if you trade stocks, You better have your FED Taxes checked, If you used there software

Message.Msg: standard version only allows less than 500 trades per day, deluxe version has trouble over 1000. Your downloaded broker statement will look correct in the summary section (interview), but the data gets truncated in the Sched D/8949, which completely screws up your totals and cap gains. If you try to enter by hand in the sched D (and attach broker detail in seperate 8949), it only allows 9 digits sum for transaction total inlcuding cents, so max is $9,999,999.99. While that sounds like a lot, that is only one $40k trasaction per day for 250 trading days. Obviously day-traders do more than that.

Message.Title: AMZM now has higher Enterprise Value to Sales than Apple !!!
Message.Msg: We're not talking earnings here - simple EV to sales ratio (EV = market cap less cash + debt). AMZN = $113B Enterprise value, TTM sales = $61B, EV/S = 1.85 AAPL = $280B Enterprise value, TTM sales $164B, EV/S = 1.70 Investors feel that each $ of Amazon sales should be valued higher than Apple's .. Unreal when Apple drops 22c of every dollar to the bottom line, and Amazon zero .. Apple even gives back 2.3c of every sales $ as dividend to investors ... go figure.

Topic.Title: AMZM now has higher Enterprise Value to Sales than Apple !!!

Message.Msg: Once: This will prove to be the biggest predatory trading scam in history. There is NO basis under which an investor responsible for OTHER PEOPLE'S MONEY would see those relative valuations as making sense. This has been deliberate and painted IMHO. The investing retail public, which holds lots of AAPL, will be incensed IMHO when this is presented properly. It wreaks of manipulation.... Patience. Amazon is going to have to report and its economics are far more sensitive to the economy than people think. It is likely going to have to cut back on expansion (which ruins the growth/same day hype) or raise more cash (cash was already challenged and days payable hitting records in Q4, despite the $3B offering) to maintain it. Either way, not going to be fun for Amazon longs in 2013.

Message.Msg: Does anyone know if there is any other tax sofware that you can download your data into

Topic.Title: TurboTax has a big problem if you trade stocks, You better have your FED Taxes checked, If you used there software

Message.Msg: Intuit has pro program call Intuit Proseries for $225. It is for tax accountants, but very similar to Turbo tax - with the major exception of no interview step through (the easy guide). You have to step through it yourself. It can handle large broker files, etc...

Message.Title: Dog Race...
Message.Msg: Sybs: INTC has Altera as a high volume 14 foundry partner for its FPGAs (I knew that security concerns would dictate that INTC become the manufacturer of choice for all high end signal processing chips and said as much on this and on INTC boards). AAPL will be using INTC soon enough. INTC is heading higher, regardless of macro stuff because it simply is the only company in the world capable of manufacturing all our high end signal processing / communication chips in a secure domestic location. Ironically, analysts beat the #$%$ out of INTC for investing in 14nm capacity, which is absolutely unique in the world. At the same time, they fawn over AMZN investing in redundant distribution and warehousing capacity and losing money on it.... I said months ago that the strategic implications of INTC's expansion were very different than AMZN's (INTC's hurts TSMC economics...., Amazon's is just wasted expansion that doesn't meaningfully alter the economics of its competitors). Many of the analysts here (particularly ones who cover INTC and bashed its investment in 14nm capacity) should be taken to the woodshed.... Where you see global meltdown, I see a major structural shift and rebalancing. INTC will be a winner. This pair (AMZN and INTC) will also prove a great case study on the intellectual dishonesty on WS, trying to always front run and dump #$%$ on retail or shakeout on good investments. Capital World has done some things that bear extraordinary scrutiny IMHO. After Cash's comments earlier today, I need to start looking into the quant funds to see position changes (I found with CMG that certain quant funds change in positions was well correlated with changes in multiples...). Probably the same scam running here.... Tech

Topic.Title: Techstrategy is in the red with long SNPH, too.

Message.Msg: Could you be stupider? (yes I know the grammar is incorrect., but it just seemed appropriate for you). You probably mean NSPH. I loaded up at $1 and used the volatility to average down profitably. I also counseled people to be careful as it is a speculative play with real upside, but material risk because of the likelihood of a future cramdown. Several of the folks on this board have done quite well on it buying in below $1. My INTC calls are 2014 and 2015. The short term simply doesn't matter. The risk is defined and the upside enormous. I will be proven correct there within that timeframe. You are losing it Geeg. You and the scam you've been pumping will soon get some sunlight (UV radiation is good for eliminating lower life forms such as bacteria...).

Geeg, I am a #$%$ trader. But, I read the fundamentals and evolving competitive dynamics as well as anyone (including figuring out the fundamental limitations of Amazon's business model about a year before the analysts will have caught on... ). The reality is that Scamazon is doomed to fall precipitously. The scam is coming to an end. The math doesn't work and cash flows/profts simply will not scale as you pumpers are claiming.

Topic.Title: AMZN stock seems very sensitive to upside bids today: the momo gamblers are in the sandbox the last two days after it was hit down to 255-6

Message.Msg: What was truly profoundly scary was Greenspan saying only the stock market reaction to the sequestration mattered -- because stock prices account for 6% of economic activity. The Fed will fail and it will be ugly. We are past the event horizon. The student loan delinquencies are the canary in the coalmine. Subprime auto will be next. Pumping money into the system top down cannot address bottom up structural issues...

Topic.Title: AMZN stock seems very sensitive to upside bids today: the momo gamblers are in the sandbox the last two days after it was hit down to 255-6

Message.Msg: Bernanke knows exactly what he is doing. He is trying to maintain nominal asset prices through an inherently deflationary period so that his masters (the banking cartel) do not have to realize losses. Instead, all the losses are socialized and transferred to the general public through lower real discretionary incomes. It isn't working because he is running into system level constraints. The act printing money to inflate assets also inflates assets that everyone depend upon, which makes for higher cost of necessities for everyone. That, in turn, reduces discretionary income (particularly in the highest marginal propensity to consume segments), which then creates a negative feedback loop in an economy that is 70% consumption... There is a path out of all of this without massive societal disruption (still significant, but not violent) and that brings the global economy back into better balance. Right now, TPTB are choosing the wrong path but are close to realizing that the current approach will not work. The endgame is nearer than people realize.
